intro: Armeria plantaginea subsp. montcaunica, commonly known as the mountain armeria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically succulent, fleshy, and arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
